Package com.example.lotteryevent.repository

Class EntrantListRepositoryImpl

java.lang.Object
com.example.lotteryevent.repository.EntrantListRepositoryImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEntrantListRepository
public class EntrantListRepositoryImpl extends Object implements IEntrantListRepository
This class is responsible for retrieving entrant information for events and sending organizer notifications to individual entrants. It communicates with Firestore to fetch entrant data based on status and uses NotificationCustomManager to send notifications.

This repository implements IEntrantListRepository and exposes LiveData streams so that UI layers can observe entrant list updates.

See Also:

    • fetchEntrantsByStatus

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<List<Entrant>> fetchEntrantsByStatus(String eventId, String status)
      Retrieves a list of entrants for a given event from Firestore whose status field matches the specified value. The result is delivered through a LiveData object so that UI components can observe updates asynchronously.

      If either eventId or status is null, an empty list is returned immediately.

      Firestore Callbacks:

      • OnSuccessListener — Fired when Firestore successfully returns matching entrant documents. Converts each document into an Entrant object and posts the list to LiveData.
      • OnFailureListener — Fired when Firestore query fails. Logs the error and posts an empty list to LiveData.
      Specified by:
      fetchEntrantsByStatus in interface IEntrantListRepository
      Parameters:
      eventId - the Firestore event document ID for which entrants should be fetched
      status - the status filter (accepted, waiting, cancelled, invited) used to match entrants in the event's subcollection
      Returns:
      a LiveData stream containing the list of entrants matching the given status

    • fetchAllEntrants

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<List<Entrant>> fetchAllEntrants(String eventId)
      Retrieves a list of ALL entrants for a given event from Firestore, regardless of their status. Used for the Entrant Map.
      Specified by:
      fetchAllEntrants in interface IEntrantListRepository
      Parameters:
      eventId - the Firestore event document ID
      Returns:
      a LiveData stream containing the list of all entrants

    • notifyEntrant

      public void notifyEntrant(String uid, String eventId, String organizerMessage)
      Sends a custom notification message to an individual entrant. Fetches the event's details from Firestore to correctly populate the notification fields (event name, organizer information, message content) before dispatching the notification through NotificationCustomManager.

      If uid or eventId is null, the request is considered invalid and no notification is sent.

      Firestore Callbacks:

      • OnSuccessListener — Retrieves event metadata (name, organizer ID, organizer name). Constructs the full notification message and sends it to the specified user.
      • OnFailureListener — Logs any error that occurs when trying to fetch the event information.
      Specified by:
      notifyEntrant in interface IEntrantListRepository
      Parameters:
      uid - the unique identifier of the entrant to send the notification to
      eventId - the Firestore event ID associated with the notification
      organizerMessage - the message written by the organizer to be included in the notification

    • updateEntrantStatus

      public void updateEntrantStatus(String eventId, String userId, String newStatus, IEntrantListRepository.StatusUpdateCallback callback, boolean sendNotif)
      Updates the status of a specific entrant (e.g., from "invited" to "waiting").
      Specified by:
      updateEntrantStatus in interface IEntrantListRepository
      Parameters:
      eventId - The event ID.
      userId - The entrant's user ID.
      newStatus - The new status to set.
      callback - A callback to handle success/failure in the ViewModel.
      sendNotif - Boolean indicating whether to send notif to entrant on status update, currently only handles cancellation (new status being "waiting")
